page.title: 03PUMPING STATIONS...
page.content: Most of this area consisted of pasture or grassland belonging to High Low Hall Farm although Summer Grove pumping station and the West Cumberland Hospital appeared in the corners of this square. Summer Grove pumping station pumps water from Ennerdale Lake to areas of Whitehaven and was built in 1952 to cope with increasing demand from industry,especially Marchon.The water is pumped by 17-130hp generators to areas higher than Summer Grove.Standby generators are available in case of power cuts. Nearby Summer Grove house is being used as a hostel for nearby Sellafield workers.Previously Summer Grove was a mansion with its own gardens and drive.A lodge(which still has a coat of arms above the door)stands at the entrance.
